tasks.description: Add salary display line to job list items in JobListPanel
steps: Open orchestrator in browser and navigate to job list view
Verify salary displays on third line below employer/location for jobs with salary data
Verify 'Salary not listed' displays for jobs without salary data
Verify text styling matches employer line (text-xs text-muted-foreground)
Verify mt-0.5 margin-top spacing is applied
Verify text truncates properly if salary string is very long
Verify no TypeScript errors in JobListPanel.tsx

tasks.description: Verify salary displays correctly in all preview panes
steps: Select a job with salary data from list and verify JobHeader shows salary with DollarSign icon
Navigate to 'discovered' tab and verify DecideMode shows salary in JobHeader
Navigate to 'ready' tab and verify ReadyPanel shows salary in JobHeader
Select a job without salary data and verify JobHeader shows salary appropriately
Verify salary formatting is consistent between list view and preview panes

tasks.description: Verify layout quality and edge cases
steps: Test with jobs that have very long salary strings (e.g., 'GBP 100000-200000 / year with additional benefits and bonuses')
Verify no layout breaks or overflow issues
Test with jobs that have null salary data
Test with jobs that have empty string salary data
Test responsive layout on mobile viewport (320px width)
Verify vertical alignment remains consistent across all job items
Verify no visual regressions in status indicator dot, title, employer line, or score display
